text: CLOSE ON a pair of hands from VARIOUS ANGLES... The SOUNDS of the fighting grow LOUDER. Punches, kicks, e The hands tense into fists. They're strong hands. Fighter ZOOM OUT TO REVEAL Julian (mid-thirties) staring at his h Even though he's kept in shape, he hasn't fought for a lo The SOUND of the boxing match gets LOUDER STILL as Julian staring at his hands - it's almost as if he's meditating. he breaths in. Behind him sits a young kid dressed in Thai boxing clothe is Liang, barely sixteen. He looks nervous, occasionally at Julian's reflection through the huge mirror that hangs far wall. Julian continues to stare at his hands and closes them in tight fist.
The SOUNDS of the boxing match reach FEVER PITCH as we TR Julian and Liang making their way towards the ring.

Two Young Thai Boxers beat the crap out of each other. The crowd is wild with excitement, people placing bets on way the fight will turn. One of the Thai Boxers goes down and money immediately st changing hands... The ring is cleared and Liang jumps in as Julian pushes h though the crowd, nodding at people as he passes. They kn here. ... I love violence! Billy offers Julian a hit from his bottle of Mehkong whis Julian refuses. He's more interested in the fight. BACK TO THE RING where the fight has just started. Liang immediately on the ropes. Julian watches, concerned. Billy takes a phone call but he can't hear. He nods to Ju and takes it outside. BACK TO THE FIGHT where Liang pulls an amazing move. Turn tables. Takes the bigger man down with a series of jabs, and backfists. As Julian applauds Liang's success, Billy slinks off out auditorium. Liang wins the fight with a knock out... The crowd go wil adulation... Julian watches, transfixed... Liang is lit up by a beatific white light... As he stands in the middle of the ring, the crowd start to gather roun Julian continues to stare at what's taking place before h ... Which is almost like a religious ceremony... The audi bow down before Liang as he stares out into the light... of calm washing over his face... A sense of stillness and Enlightenment through victory and violence...
Billy stalks the streets of the city of vice. A man on a

Liang is sitting on a bench, his constantly-smiling Mothe him, as Julian peels off fifty Bhat notes. We get the sense that Julian's proud of him, that Liang i of a protege of his and that Liang is incredibly pleased gained his approval.
Two fifty, three hundred... Liang takes the money. Julian pulls off two more notes. A
You did well out there. You've got something, Liang. Potential, yeah? Liang nods.
Don't spend it all in once place.
Billy comes down a back ally and knocks on a door. After the door opens. The Doorman recognises him and lets him enter.

WE TRACK with Billy as he makes his way through the small subterranean nightclub. A Thai man - known as The Lizard - sits by a table with a locals gambling... He spots Billy and follows him with his eyes as he contin gamble. Billy moves across to a small private corner... ... where he meets various men and women, all smoking Methamphetamine. Billy joins in but an argument quickly s up between him and another Thai Man. The music's too loud to hear what they're arguing about b suddenly gets out of control... Billy starts viciously hi the Thai Man and quickly the room EXPLODES in a frenzy of

A fan does what it can to cool Julian down as he counts o at his desk. Sitting opposite him, feet on the table, is Julian's lieutenant and the closest thing to a friend he' Julian's phone rings. He interrupts his counting. Picks u listens...
(ON THE PHONE)
Hold on, hold on. What did he say? Beat as Julian listens. He glances over at Gordon who loo concerned.
(ON THE PHONE)
No, tell him to stay there. Tell them both to stay there. Beat.
(ON THE PHONE)
I'm coming over.
The Lizard sits outside the nightclub, somehow managing t a cigarette at the same time as he stems the flow of bloo his nose with a handkerchief. Julian and Gordon arrive.
He still in there?
... No. Beat... Julian glances at Gordon.
You told him I was coming...
Wouldn't listen... Julian stares at him...
Well maybe you didn't try hard enough. The Lizard takes the handkerchief away from his nose. Sho bloodstain to Julian.
When was the last time you slept? The Lizard smiles but stares at Julian with hatred in his

Just cause I ain't slept for three days, don't mean I don't know right from wrong... and your brother has become a real problem... Again Julian stares at him - clenching his fist. The Liza this but gazes up into Julian's face blankly.
You're not going to cause another ruckus in my club now - are you? A long pause as Julian considers it.
No.
Good - 'cause Billy ripped me off and then he broke my face... Julian turns to Gordon.
Like I always said. One day he's going to meet the devil. Beat.
You know where he is now? The Lizard stares at Julian.
Bangkok has millions of people my friend. You and your brother, you're lost to my world... The Lizard gets up - puts out his cigarette and looks at
So what you going to do? You wanna come in? Very good amphetamine in here... Julian looks over to Gordon. Sees he's keen.
You go. I'm gonna look around. See if I can find him.
Sure--?
Go on. He turns back to The Lizard.
Which way'd he go? The Lizard nods his head towards the busy street. Julian and heads off... Gordon steps up to the entrance to the c The Lizard sticks out an arm, blocking his way.
His brother didn't pay.
So? That's his problem.
Now it's your problem.
I'm with you mate. Billy's fucked--
You don't pay his debt - you don't enter. Gordon thinks for beat. Takes out his money...
How much...? ...and The Lizard smiles for the first time.
Julian is talking to Ma Long, fifties, the mother figure group of girls who stand in the background.
You seen Billy?
Not this evening. A particularly pretty prostitute catches Juilan's eye. He at her, stone faced.
Well if he comes in, tell him I'm looking for him, yeah?
He's not coming in. I tell him to stay away. He hurt one of my girls Julian. Not good... Julian considers. Pulls out his wad of notes again. Hands to Ma Long.

Yeah, well... if you see him, tell him I'm looking for him... Ma Long nods as she takes the money. Julian is about to leave. He looks at the pretty prostitu Stares at her for a moment. Then walks out.

Billy's so wasted he's bumping into people. He starts win shopping the various brothels that line the street: group girls smiling at him... Anything for a price... PICK OUT one particularly young-looking girl. Just fiftee She makes eye contact with Billy... He smiles... Pulls ou of notes...

Julian out in the middle of the road. Girls on the paveme in the windows. A steady line of punters cruising past. He stands alone. Focussed. Watchful. An island in a sea o It feels ominous. Like something really bad's about to ha
CLOSE ON Chang, mid-forties, a man who looks like he's ca out of stone. The neon lights bleed over his face in a se unending flow as he's driven towards his destination.
Police cars are parked up outside. Chang gets out of his Pays the driver. Makes his way inside.

Chang makes his way up the stairs to a landing where a GR POLICEMEN are gathered. Their circle opens up as Chang ap and they bow as he joins them - like he's a God. One of t Kim Han Ho, gestures towards the door of Room 610 where T stand guard. Chang gives a nod and the door is opened.

Chang stands silhouetted in the doorway. Stepping into th he moves into the light in CLOSE UP. His face is a mask. The bed is drenched in blood. The fifteen year old prosti lies naked on her back. She's dead, her body having been beaten in some sort of brutal sex game gone wrong. Billy is slumped in the corner in his underpants, his eye staring at MTV, a bottle of Mehkong whiskey in his hand, pipe on the floor. Chang stares at him, giving nothing away.
The Hotel Owner serves tea to Chang who sits in silence w Lieutenant Kim. The door is open and we can see into room across the corridor where Billy is still sat staring at t television.
A young cop, Daeng, who has been watching Chang, summons to whisper to his superior officer, Phaiban.
Who is that guy? Phaiban says nothing.
Is he a cop?
He was... Before Daeng can ask another questions, two more cops lea older Thai man, Choi Yan Lee (50's, overweight, dragged s from his bed) down the corridor towards the crime scene.

As Choi Yan Lee is delivered to the doorway, Chang gets u goes over to him. A moment of uncertainty in Choi Yan Lee's face. Fear. He know why he's been brought here. He looks for some comfor Chang. Chang gives him nothing.
Chang leads Choi Yan Lee to the doorway. Slowly Choi Yan what he's looking at. His daughter. Dead. Mutilated. Every father's worst nightmare.
Is this your daughter? Beat.
Yes.
How could you? ... but Choi Yan Lee just stares at his daughter. Finally
... What?
How could you let this happen?
I didn't do anything.
Well now's your chance. A long moment between them as Choi Yan Lee fails to under what Chang is suggesting. Chang stands back.
Do what thou will. Choi Yan Lee nods. Chang leaves the room, closing the doo him.

Chang sits drinking tea in silence with Lieutenant Kim. T in the corridor stare at the closed door of Room 610 from we hear the cries of Billy being beaten to death. ANGLE ON: Daeng who's starting to look scared. Phaiban pu reassuring hand on his shoulder. As the beating reaches its climax, with Choi Yan Lee scre out Thai obscenities, we hear the sickening sound of Bill snapping. And then a regular thud as blow after blow rain on his body.

Chang opens the door and looks through. Choi Yan Lee is sitting breathlessly on the floor covered In his hand he holds a piece of wood he has ripped from a Billy lies dead, his head completely smashed in.
A police car drives through the city streets and onto the heading out of town.
The bloodied Choi Yan Lee sits in the back, Chang on one Kim on the other. As the police car turns onto a more maj Choi Yan Lee starts to get nervous.
You missed my turning. I live that way. Beat. Chang says nothing. Phaiban is driving, Daeng in th passenger seat. Daeng looks back at them through the rear mirror...
We'll get you there.
The Police Car heads over the Mega Bridge and continues i out of town.
The bright white headlights of the stationary police car Choi Yan Lee who's caught in their glare, rigid with fear
I'm so sorry. Please. Please. Please don't hurt me. I'm so sorry.
What are you sorry for?
I thought... You were there. He killed my daughter. I thought you were letting me...
Answer the question. What are you sorry for? Beat. Choi Yan Lee is wrongfooted. Tentatively...
I killed the Westerner?
And why did you do that?
He killed my daughter.
And why did he do that? Choi Yan Lee can't answer.
How old was she?
Fifteen...
You knew what she was doing and you did nothing.
How else can we make money? Four daughters. No sons. What else could I do? Daeng watches as Kim opens the boot and pulls something o walks towards Chang and hands it to him. Daeng sees that an axe.
What did you expect me to do? You have to have pity on me. My daughter's just been murdered.

This isn't about her. This is about your other three daughters and making sure you don't forget them. Chang nods to Kim and Phaiban who grab hold of Choi Yan L slips a plastic strap around Choi Yan Lee's arm, using it tourniquet. They wrestle him to the ground and pull his a
I won't forget. I promise. Forgive me. Chang approaches with the axe. He stops for a moment. Loo at him...
I'll change. I'll be a better man.
I know. Chang slams down the axe, severing Choi Yan Lee's arm at Choi Yan Lee SCREAMS in agony.

The anonymity of a hotel room. Julian opens the curtains see the sky line of Bangkok - he looks out. He lies back on the bed, surfing through two hundred TV c Settles on a boxing match. Starts drifting off... As he drifts we hear the SOUND OF SINGING. A karaoke rend of 'I Hung My Head' by Johnny Cash.
I set off running to wake from the dream My brother's rifle went into the sheen I kept on running Into the south lands That's where they found me My head in my hands
REVEAL that the voice is that of Chang and he's not half deeper than you'd have though, and with it comes a stage a sort of John Wayne swagger...

The sheriff he asked me Why I had run And then it came to me Just what I had done And all for no reason Just one piece of lead I hung my head I hung my head. The policemen, still dressed in their uniforms, watch in respectful silence. Daeng sits with them. He too watches
Chang travels home across the city.
Chang opens the door as quietly as he can. He slips off h and walks gingerly into the apartment.
On the kitchen table Chang sees a picture. A badly-drawn with a man, a woman and a child. Across the bottom: "LOVE

head_text.subj: DADDY FROM DAUGHTER AND WIFE XXX'

text: Chang stares at it and smiles - picks it up and pins it t fridge with a magnet.
Chang and Kanita, his eight year old daughter, are playin her dolls who have captured a soft toy.
So now that they've caught him... What are they going to do? Kanita thinks for a moment.
Put him in jail.
Come on. They haven't got a jail big enough. Look at the size of him. Again Kanita thinks.
Keep him as a pet?
But he blew down all their houses. Would you want to keep a pet that could do that? Kanita shakes her head.
What if they just let him go?
How could they be sure he wouldn't do it again?
They could ask him...? Very nicely? Chang picks up the soft toy. Peels off a sticker from a s and places it between its eyes. Satisfied with his work h the soft toy back in the middle of the game.

"And so the king and the fairies that lived in the village said to the creature: this is your mark which will stay with you forever. If you ever try and blow down our village again, it will heat up until it boils your brains, for it has magical properties. Go in peace. Kanita nods, happy with the judgement. She picks the soft up and 'walks' it away from the village of the dolls.

Chang walks into his bedroom where his wife Nadee is just up. He kisses her good morning. As he starts to undress, she starts to get dressed. They a smile about this. Finally Chang lies down on the bed an his eyes. Nadee kisses him good night.
Nadee starts making breakfast as Kanita watches cartoons.

As Chang sleeps the heavy curtains are drawn to keep out of the day - but they cannot deaden the sound of the city as it goes about its frenetic everyday business. The CAMERA MOVES through the apartment, briefly settling sleeping Chang, then roaming through the various rooms, P OUT different objects... We see that Chang is obsessed with cowboy films and a kee - the sitting room is stuffed with movie posters, photogr and other bits of movie memorabilia... Amongst the many family photos we also PICK OUT several p of Chang when he was in the army and shots of what looks a very successful career as a Thai boxer. At the end of the tour we're back with Chang. We ZOOM IN tight CLOSE SHOT.

We see a hotel room door and hear a knock - Julian ENTERS and opens to reveal... ...Two Thai girls - one being Mai - standing in the hallw lets them enter. Mai embraces Julian, kissing him on the mouth as Julian c the door. They turn to consider the other girl who is starting to u She smiles compliantly, eager to please. Julian turns back to Mai and kisses her again. As the kis more passionate, the other girl joins them and the three begin to have sex.
Chang is sitting eating alone at the dinning table, watch old western on TV.
Chang walks down the streets towards a school. Standing a gate, Kanita is waiting for him. He hugs her and they hol as they continue down the crowded street.

Chang waits patiently at the counter as Kanita sorts thro various dolls, trying to choose which one to buy... Chang looks round and gazes out the window into the stree pedestrians stream past. Suddenly Chang has a strange VIS All the women disappear. In the street there are only men We cut to a CLOSE UP of Chang and then back to his VISION Now all the men have gone and he can see only women. Back to the CLOSE UP of Chang who continues staring out o
... where everything is back to normal. Men and women wal up and down the sidewalk.

The remnants of various room service orders litter the fl with the trappings of a heavy session: empty bottles of a drug paraphernalia, etc. Julian lies sleeping, entwined in the limbs of the girl.. There is a knock on the door. Julian and the girl ignore A pause and then Julian's mobile phone starts ringing. He answer. The knocking starts up again, this time louder. Finally:
Julian's not here mate. Fuck off... Beat - then we hear a voice from behind the door.
Julian? Still they ignore him. Either too wasted or too tired to else.
Julian...? I need to talk with you... Beat. Finally Julian answers with zero energy...
What is it?
It's about Billy...
I can't deal with my brother right now... Beat.
He's dead... Julian opens his eyes, confused - still out of his head o
What? No answer. Finally Julian gets up and wraps a towel aroun body and slowly opens the door. Gordon stands in the hallway - behind him two Thai men fr crew.
What happened?
They found his body in a hotel room... Julian doesn't know what to say... Neither does Gordon.

Look, get dressed and I'll see you downstairs. Julian nods and closes the door. He stands still - glance the window - seeing the sun setting and the night coming glances at the pretty girl still sleeping on the bed. He goes into the bathroom where Mai is dressed and puttin make up.
What happened? Julian looks at her.
Someone killed Billy... The camera ZOOMS IN on Mai.

A Mortuary Attendant pulls a sheet back to reveal - Billy. His body completely mutilated. Julian stares at his brother's corpse intensely, not betr any emotion. He turns to Gordon who's standing behind him.
What do we do?
For now... We wait. Julian glances back at the body...

Julian stares up at the night sky, his mobile phone gripp in his hand. He puts the phone down. He looks out across the city again then back to the phone It's like he's scared. He picks it up quickly and dials. A moment as it rings th answered.
Hello Mum. Beat.
It's me... Julian... Something's happened.

The CAMERA tracks as we follow a pair of high heeled shoe to an elegant woman in her fifties, who looks like she's forties and could actually pass for late thirties. She st towards reception, a Porter struggling to keep up with he is Jenna Hopkins. Head of a notorious London Crime Family of both Julian and Billy. Newly appointed Lady Macbeth of She hands her passport over to the Concierge.
I'd like to check in now please. The Concierge checks the computer.
I'm afraid the room won't be ready until four o'clock. Beat... Jenna just stares at him...
... It's policy
I'd like to speak to your manager. Beat.
Yes of course... The Concierge retreats. Jenna lights a cigarette.
Good afternoon madam, what seems to be the problem?

Listen to me... I've just travelled six thousand miles to see the corpse of my first born son and I haven't slept for thirty hours and he says I can't go to my room. The Manager just stares at her but is clearly taken back force...
I'm sorry madam...
How much?
... it simply isn't possible. Jenna pulls out a massive bundle of notes. Peels off a co of hundred dollar bills.
...Fuck off you cunt, just hand me the fucking key... She lays the money on the desk. The manager looks around.
Well I might be able to arrange something... The Manager turns to the Concierge.
Don't leave the money there. Some cunt'll nick it. Put it in your pocket. The Manager hesitates.
Put it in your pocket.
There's really no need--
Put it in your fucking pocket. The Manager takes the money. Pockets it. Places the key o desk.
Room 300.
The lift doors open and Jenna walks out, the Porter strug to keep up with her as she swishes down the corridor.

The struggling Porter opens the door and lets Jenna in. S into the suite and gives it the once over. Satisfactory. The Porter places her bags on the side and hangs up some clothes, desperate to try and get out in one piece... As as he's finished he bows and starts to shuffle out of the
Hey... Open this. Jenna points to the Duty Free bag then starts running a b beginning to undress.
I need a drink. The Porter is stunned.

Well don't just stand there... The Porter fumbles, taking the gin out of the Duty Free b the tonic in his nervousness as he makes her cocktail. Jenna returns in a dressing gown, takes the drink off him takes a huge slug. The Porter is terrified, stunned. Rooted to the spot. Jenna sits on the bed and stares out of the window. Just Porter thinks it's safe to try edging out of the room aga starts talking to him...
I loved him so much you know... Billy... Beat. The Porter doesn't know what the fuck she's talking
Everyone loves their children don't they? Well, not everyone, but... She looks over at him. The Porter smiles at her.

Do you want to see a picture? The Porter nods, uncertain. Jenna gets up, goes over to h Opens it up. A picture of Billy. She hands it to the Porter - who takes it and just looks not knowing what to do... Jenna starts to cry. For a long time. Finally...
Madam. I have to return to my station. Jenna snaps out of it in an instant.
What, yeah, thanks. She pulls a fifty dollar bill out of her purse. She hands money to the Porter who leaves as quickly as he dares.
BLACK. We hear Dave Berry singing 'Mama'.

The elevator doors open. Julian steps out into the empty Everything is normal... But everything is also not normal The CAMERA tracks from behind as Julian walks - looking a doors as he passes them and finally stopping in front of He knocks but there is no answer. Realizing the door isn' he pushes it open and steps in.

The room is exactly the same as the one Jenna's staying i instead of her, Julian sees a man sitting on the bed, his to him. His features are obscured... Julian slowly begins to walk towards him, but before he c out, the figure turns to face him... It's Chang. But there is blood smeared all over his face. Julian stares at him in horror. Slowly he looks down at h only to discover that they're dripping in blood... We ZOOM IN on his hands.

Julian wakes from his nightmare - covered in sweat. He is He sits up. Looks at his hands, still very shaken by his We hear the traffic of Bangkok. Julian gets up and walks table... Light up and begins to smoke morphine... He walk the window and looks out over Bangkok... His phone rings - Julian answers...
(ON THE PHONE)
Hello?
It's me...
(ON THE PHONE)
Hi Mum. Where are you?
I'm in Bangkok...
(ON THE PHONE)
What? Julian looks at his watch.
(ON THE PHONE)
... I thought you didn't get in til midnight...? Beat.
I needed to be by myself...
(ON THE PHONE)
Okay... so, what d'you want to do?
Raise Hell... Julian turns his back to the window.

Jenna looks immaculate. She stubs out her cigarette when Julian making his way towards her. She gets up and they e She holds on to him. A little too long. Finally she pulls away. She looks at him for a long time.
Could it be have been one of the gangs?
Maybe. Take your pick. Billy wasn't popular.
What do you mean?
You know Billy... He was eccentric. Jenna smiles to herself as if this brings back memories a even smiles. Both sit in silence for a moment.
But you're going to find out who did it, right?
I'll make sure it gets done.
No, it needs to be you that does it. We need to show them. Do you understand what I'm saying?
Yeah, okay, I'll do it.
Good. HOLD ON Julian as we bring up the SOUND of Johnny Cash's of Fire.
Love is a burning thing And it makes a firey ring Bound by wild desire I fell into a ring of fire
Chang is singing again...

I fell into a burning ring of fire I went down, down, down And the flames went higher And it burns, burns, burns The Ring of Fire / The Ring of Fire And the cops are all there, Daeng included, watching him.
Chang's singing continues as we see an assortment of toug Thai Men listening to Gordon (MUTE).

I fell into a burning ring of fire I went down, down, down And the flames went higher And it burns, burns, burns The Ring of Fire / The Ring of Fire Gordon explains the situation: what information they're a how much they'll get paid for good leads. All the while Julian watches from the background.
A montage of Julian's crew spreading out, shaking down th various contacts: doormen, pimps, dirty cops, stall holde barmen...

The taste of love is sweet When hearts like ours meet I fell for you like a child Oh, but the fire went wild. One of the crew, the rat faced Charlie Ling, starts talki the Hotel Owner who was there the night of the murder. A of hundred Bhat notes and he starts talking...
Chang reaches the climax of the song.
I fell into a burning ring of fire I went down, down, down And the flames went higher And it burns, burns, burns The Ring of Fire / The Ring of Fire The Cops watch with total devotion.

A Tuck-tuck makes its way through the crowded streets dri one of Choi Yan Lee's Three Daughter's. In the back sits Choi Yan Lee, his stump of an arm in a s a daughter either side of him. His arm's only just been bandaged up and he's clearly sti a lot of pain, his face going into spasm with every bump road.

Julian stands on the street corner sipping a soft drink. Behind him Gordon, his phone glued to his face. On the other side of the road is Choi Yan Lee's Kiosk, bi to double as his home, currently manned by his long suffe wife Kim Yan Lee. She serves a chilled coconut to a man. turns round we reveal... he's a particularly murderous lo member of Julian's crew - Ko Sam. We pick out Charlie Ling a little further down the road, looking at a tray of battery powered robots that some Str selling. They're all counting down the minutes. Biding their time. for Choi Yan Lee to turn up. Finally the sound of the Tuck-tuck approaching... Ko Sam drinks his coconut down in one - slurping as he hi bottom. Letting the empty shell fall to the floor. Charlie Ling stands up. Feels the gun under his jacket. The Tuck-tuck pulls up and Choi Yan Lee's Daughters help the kiosk that doubles as their home. Julian and his men close in.

As Choi Yan Lee enters his home and his daughters make a of him, the shutters of the kiosk counter are suddenly SL SHUT. They all turn round in panic, but before they can do anyt about it, the last of the three daughters is pushed into followed by Ko Sam, Charlie Ling, Gordon and Julian. Choi Yan Lee snivels in the corner, waving his bandaged a the air.
You can't kill me. I'm a cripple.
Who are you? What do you think you're doing? Get out or we'll call the police. Ko Sam shakes his head at her. Not a good idea. Julian tu Charlie Ling.
Ask him if he's Choi Yan Lee. At the mention of his name the colour drains from Choi Ya face. His eyes lock with Julian's.
Is your name Choi Yan Lee? Choi Yan Lee nods his head.
Ask him why he killed my brother.
You killed his brother. Big mistake fat man. Why'd you do it? Beat. Choi Yan Lee knows he's been caught...
He murdered my daughter.
He says he killed his daughter. Julian considers him for a moment. Slowly he pulls out a Aims it at Choi Yan Lee's face...

Oh God. Please don't kill me. Please. I'll give you anything. Anything you want. My daughters. My shop. Please. I've paid for what I did. Look at me. In his desperation Choi Yan Lee suddenly lurches forward, brandishing his wounded arm at Julian. He pulls the banda exposing the bloody stump.
I've paid for what I did. Don't you see? Julian turns to Charlie Ling.
What's he saying? Beat.
He says... He says he's paid for what he's done. That he's been punished already. Choi Yan Lee nods his head enthusiastically.
He told me to do it. Then he took my hand. Look. Again he thrusts his stump at Julian who glances at him.
Who did that to him? Choi Yan Lee looks at the various faces that surround him stares directly at Julian.
The Angel of Vengeance... Charlie Ling looks at him surprised... yet there's a sens deep down he knows what he's talking about...
It's a lie - he doesn't exist...
I'm telling the truth. It was the Angel of Vengeance.
What's he saying?
He's lying...
Tell me.

It's a story old women tell their grand children... 'The Angel of Vengeance' is supposed to come down from the heavens and judge the living... restore karma to the world.. Gordon laughs... but Julian listens with great interest..
How does he do that?
Leads people to their destiny... That's the myth anyway. Ko Sam smiles. Julian doesn't. Finally:
Ask him who cut his hand off. Charlie Ling's reluctant to question him further. Julian
Do it.
Who turned you into a cripple - and no bullshit this time. Choi Yan Lee continues babbling hysterically...
(IN THAI, QUIETLY)
I'm telling you the truth... The Angel of Vengeance is real... He made me do it... You've got to believe me... I've already been judged.
He says it was The Angel of Vengeance... Choi Yan Lee starts to giggle uncontrollably.
The Angel of Vengeance. Yes. You don't find the Angel of Vengeance. No. He finds you.
What's he saying?
Pull yourself together fat man. If you don't talk sense I'll cut off your cock and shove it down your throat.
I'm telling you the truth. He'll find you. Choi Yan Lee retreats to the corner of the room.
What did he say? Charlie Ling considers Choi Yan Lee. Realizes he's not go get a better answer out of him...
He said you don't find The Angel of Vengeance. He finds you... Julian considers this for a long time. He realises he's n his gun anymore. Puts it away.
Are we going to kill him or what? The room suddenly feels stuffy. The atmosphere oppressive Julian's got to get out...
What are you doing? But Julian's already stumbling out of the kiosk...
Nothing... We're not going to do anything... Just leave him. Leave them all.

Julian stumbles out of the kiosk and breaths in lungfulls Disoriented, he careers into a stall selling various reli artefacts, sending candles, incense and statues of Buddha flying... He falls to the ground. When he gets to his feet everythi him seems intense and incredibly vibrant... The dogs figh on the street, the Buddha that lies in pieces on the grou children that stand watching him, his crew as they come o the kiosk, hiding their guns... Julian takes a long moment to get his bearings... Finally up, but as he does he feels different... As if the axis o world has shifted...

The CAMERA TRACKS from the side as we see Jenna walk thro boxing gym. All around her people are fighting and sparri She spots Julian and Gordon through the large windows of They see her and stand up. We LINGER OUTSIDE in the training area as Jenna goes thro DOOR...
Boxers train in the background. Jenna, Julian and Gordon silence. Finally:
Did you kill him? Beat. A shared look between Gordon and Julian.
It's a little bit more complicated than that Mum.
